intro: Bicornella jumellenana, commonly known as the Jumellen's bicorn, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
